title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 910.4 - Special conditions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 910.4 - Special conditions

State Regulations
(a) All
streams or other bodies of water which appear as black lines with accompanying
waters index numbers on the reference maps herein, or which appear as blue
continuous or dotted lines to indicate natural waters on the original published
maps listed above, and which natural waters are not specifically designated in
table I, shall be assigned the same classes and standards of quality and purity
as the specifically designated waters to which they are directly
tributary. (b) All streams, rivulets, and other collections of natural surface waters within the portion of
the St. Lawrence River drainage basin as above defined, which waters are not
shown on the original published maps listed above, shall be assigned to class D
with standards of quality and purity for class D assigned thereto, provided, however, that any continuous flowing natural stream which is not shown on the
reference maps in section
910.9, infra, shall have the same
classification and assigned standards as the waters to which it is directly
tributary. (c) Notwithstanding the
items indicated in table I and the aforementioned special conditions statements
which, in some instances, may indicate assignment of classifications for waters
contained within the boundaries of the State-owned forest preserve lands and, therefore, controlled under the provisions of the State constitution and the

Conservation Law, such waters are hereby excluded from classification to the
extent that any part of such waters may be located within the boundaries of the

State-owned forest preserve lands. All waters within 100 feet of the boundaries
of the State-owned forest preserve lands shall be assigned to class A with
standards of quality and purity for class A. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
910.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
